did.abstract: Billie Louise Edwards was a feminist, activist, lesbian, motorcyclist, co-parent, Metropolitan Community Church preacher, and clinical psychologist; she was also co-director of the University of Michigan Lesbian-Gay Male Programs Office (LGMPO) from 1987 to 1993. The Edwards papers include her educational materials and writings, training materials and correspondence from the LGMPO, audio cassettes from her ministry, and a photographic portrait.

bioghist.p: Billie Edwards was born in 1947 to a military family and moved frequently in her youth. She joined the Marine Corps in 1966 and received training in photography. She was dishonorably discharged in 1967 for her sexual orientation. President Carter had this changed to an Honorable Discharge in 1977. She worked several years in the graphic arts and later trained to be a draftsman. She became a minister with the Metropolitan Community Church in Oklahoma, later ministering in northern Virginia and Detroit. She received a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from the Union for Experimenting Colleges and Universities in Los Angeles, California in 1985 and a Master of Arts in Humanistic and Clinical Psychology from the Center for Humanistic Studies in Detroit, Michigan in 1986.

Ms. Edwards was hired as the co-director of the University of Michigan Lesbian-Gay Male Programs Office (LGMPO) in 1987. During her tenure there, she established the Educational Outreach Program, provided counseling for women and organized programs for the gay, lesbian and bi-sexual community. She resigned effective January 31, 1993 to protest against the university's decision to take counseling away from the office. She died at age 48 in 1995 of a brain tumor.

scopecontent.p: The Billie Edwards papers document her work as a lesbian-gay rights activist and co-director of the University of Michigan's Lesbian-Gay Male Program Office and her work as a minister in Metropolitan Community Church in Oklahoma City. The papers are organized into five series: Miscellaneous Personal Papers, Writings, Research Material, LGMPO Training, and LGMPO Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous Personal Papers (0.3 linear feet) include biographical information, photographs, some of her journals and schoolwork, and five audio cassettes of sermons and a workshop. Newspaper articles of interviews are included with the biographic materials. Several journals are included in spiral bound notebooks.
Edwards' Writings (0.2 linear feet) include her thesis as well as other educational papers and articles written while at the LGMPO about multi-culturalism.

scopecontent.p: The Research Material (0.3 linear feet) includes research on sexuality and sexual health.

LGMPO Training papers (0.5 linear feet) are notable for the Educational Outreach Program material along with other varied programs. These programs include workshops on Crisis Intervention and Multi-Culturalism as well as training for Hotlines, Resident Staff, and Peer Counselors. Information about Lesbian Coming-Out Support Groups are also included in this series.
